item.title: Remake_02: ft. Inkfish
item.description:
Introduction

Allrighty, let’s get right to it, InkFishNYC got a great looking page transition … I WANT IT.

Exited Pepe +

Understanding The Idea

So, it’s really not that complicated as it looks at first glance. The thing you need to do is have a container that holds a bunch of divs based on screen size. In my case I opted to have a 5x5 grid of divs that fit the screen perfectly. Then before navigating, make the blocks visible, by animating their height; stagger them randomly, and after navigate do the opposite, and voila.

item.title: Remake_01
item.description:
Introduction

Okay, so this website The Art Of Documentary has this really cool animation where one page slides up, and another one takes it’s place but, the catch is that both pages are visible, during the transition, and it gives a really unique effect. You have to check it out yourself to get what I mean since I can’t actually show a video over here ( im on vercel free plan :< ), but I will be showing how to acheive a similar effect with in: and out: directives in svelte.
